BIOGRAPHICAL SKETCH
investigator program director. Photocopy this page for each person.
NAME
Parkhurst, Kay Martin
POSITION TITLE
Research Associate
INSTITUTION AND LOCATION
YEAR
DEGREE
CONFERRED
FIELD OF STUDY
University of Nebraska College of Nursing
B.S./R.N.
R.N.
University of Nebraska, Lincoln
PhD.
Chemistry
RESEARCH AND PROFESSIONAL EXPERIENCE: Concluding with present position, list, in chronciogical order, previous employment, experience, and
honors. Key personnel include the principal investigator and any otherindividuals who participate in the scientific development or execution of the project
Key personnel typicalfy will inctude all individuals with doctoralor other professinal degrees, but in some projects will includendividuals at the masters or
bacalaureate evel provided they contnibute in a substantive way to the scientific development or execution of the project. Include presant membership on
any Federal Govemment public advisory committee.Listin chronological order the tites all authorsand compiete references to al publications during the
past three years and to representative earr publications pertinent t this aplication. if the list  publications n the last three years exceeds two pages.
select the mos! pertinent publications. DO NOT EXCEED TWO PAGES.
Honors and Awards:
Pre-doctoral fellowship, American Heart Association, NE affiliate 7/89 - 6/90
Post-doctoral fellowship, Center for Biotechnology, Univ. NE., Lincoln, 3/91 - 2/93
Publications:
K.D. Martin, L. Saari, W. Guang-Xin, T. Wang, L. J. Parkhurst, and R. V. Klucas,
"Kinetics and Thermodynamics of Oxygen, Co, and Azide Binding by the Subcomponents
of Soybean Leghemoglobin", (1990) J. Biol. Chem. 265, 19588-19593.
K.D. Martin and L.J. Parkhurst, "Kinetics and Thermodynamics of Oxygen and Carbon
Monoxide Binding to the T-State Hemoglobin of Urechis Caupo", (1990) Biochemistry
K.D. Martin and L.J. Parkhurst, "A Multipass Cuvette for Laser Photolysis Studies and Its
Uses in Studying Hemoglobin Kinetics and Equilibria", (1990) Anal. Biochem. 186, 288- 295.
K.D. Martin and L.J. Parkhurst, "Rapid Preparation of Native Alpha and Beta Chains of
Human Hemoglobin", (1992) Intl. J. Biochem. 24, 993-998.
L.J. Parkhurst, K.M. Parkhurst, and T.M. Larsen, "Oxygen Equilibrium Studies on Cyano-
Met Valency Hybrids as a Function of Protein Concentration and the Question of the
Occurrence of Quaternary Enhancement", (submitted, pre-prints available) J. Biol. Chem.
Parkhurst, L. J. and Parkhurst, K. M. (1994), "Changes in the End-to End Distance
Distribution in an Oligonucleotide Following Hybridization, Proc. Conf. Time-
Resolved Laser Spectroscopy in Biochemistry IV", SPIE 2137, 475-483.
Hileman, R. E., Parkhurst, K. M., Gupta, N. K., and Parkhurst, L. J., (1994) "Synthesis
and Characterization of Conjugates Formed between Periodate-Oxidized
Ribonucleotides and Amine-Containing Fluorophores", Bioconjugate Chemistry 5, 436-444.
Parkhurst, K. M., Hileman, R. E., Saha, D., Gupta, N. K., and Parkhurst, L. J., (1994)
"Thermodynamic Characterization of the Cooperativity of 40S Complex Formation During the
Initiation of Eukaryotic Protein Synthesis", Biochemistry 33 15168-15177.
Parkhurst, K. M. and Parkhurst, L. J. (1995), "Kinetic Studies by Fluorescence Resonance
Energy Transfer Employing a Double-Labeled Oligonucleotide: Hybridization to the
Oligonucleotide Complement and to Single Stranded DNA", Biochemistry 34, 285-292.
(Form Page 6) Page
FF
